Name: Conquest
Description:
In Conquest, players alternate turns placing an influence chip on a space adjacent to 3 or 4 cards, and then moving their marker to the next numbered space.  One player starts on the 1 space, then moves to the 2, 3, and so on; the other player starts on the 18, then moves to the 17, 16, and so on.

The game ends after 17 turns.  The player with the most chips adjacent to a card wins that card, which is worth the printed number of points.

Some cards have special abilities; for instance, in a player wins the 1, 2, and 3 cards, they achieve an auto-victory. Otherwise, the player with the most points wins.

Name: "Frösi"-Denkspiel
Description:
Each player has 8 pawns and 20 tokens of the same color. Taking turns the players place one pawn unto the gray spaces on the game board. Whenever a player places the 4th pawn around a scoring space, he puts a token on this space and scores the number of points indicated there. When all pawns have been placed on the board the moving phase starts. The pawns may move one apace in any direction or jump over any other pawn to a free space behind this pawn, trying to encircle more scoring spaces. Only 1 jump is allowed per turn.
When all scoring spaces are covered with tokens, the meeples have to reach the home spaces of their color. The game ends, when the first player has reached all 8 home spaces. Each pawn on a home space scores 3 points. The Player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Monopoly: Jurassic Park Edition
Description: Secure dinosaur paddocks and other areas but beware of the T. Rex; it doesn't follow rules! Build fences to protect paddocks from the attack and earn money by charging rent, but prepare for damaged property. Activate the gate to hear the Jurassic Park movie theme song or a dinosaur roar, which will determine how much money to collect. The last player with money when all others have gone bankrupt wins. The game also ends if the T. Rex damages all properties before they can be protected with fences or repaired. Then everyone loses!

Name: Först till skatten!
Description:
A roll and move game where you roll the dice and move your game piece every round. If you end up on a red ring, read the instruction in the speech bubble and follow it. The player who comes first to the treasure chest in the cave wins. But watch out for the troll on the way there.

The game was included in Semic´'s "Barnens Jultidning" in 1978.

Name: Reager's Return
Description:
Reager's Return is the second game of the Blackbrim Series, the sequel to Blackbrim: 1876

It has been a year since your run-in with the devious criminal Reager Skinner. Since then, there have been no new leads. You begin to accept that the trail has turned cold until a letter from the London Police arrives, asking for your help against Reager in the capital. Letter in hand, you board the next available train, though something feels amiss...

Reager's Return contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of puzzles to decipher and clues to crack.

--description from the publisher

Name: Terraforming Mars: Outdoor Sports Promo Card
Description:
Winter Season Promo 2021 of FryxGames, which you can buy on its own, or get for free if you order at their webstore.

Outdoor Sports

It's a project card with a cost of 8 M€. It has no tags.

Requirements: At least one city from any player adjacent to at least one ocean.

Effect: Raise your M€-production by 2
1 VP

Promo card X38

Name: Nuts! Compendium
Description:
The Nuts! Compendium - the perfect compliment to Nuts!. With Nuts! and Nuts! Compendium you can play any battle in WWII from anywhere and any time. Two books, that's all you need.

The Compendium contains a series of rules that can enhance and customize your NUTS games and campaigns, allowing you to run scenarios from the blazing hot deserts of North Africa to the frozen steppes of Russia.

We’ve gathered the rules from all the supplements and scenario books and brought them together in one place. Inside you'll find:


     Updated Character and figure rules, including new Nuts! Attributes and morale levels like Plucky and Fanatic.
     Privation, fatigue and Out of Supply rules for when your games get tough.
     Cavalry combat.
     Boat combat and amphibious landings.
     Night fighting.
     Rules for Airborne assaults, Ski troops, K-9 teams and Engineers.
     Enhanced artillery and air strike rules.
     Additional Chocolate & Cigarette lite RPG rules and attributes such as Wheeling & Dealing and Shell Shock.
     Optional vehicle rules, including multi-turreted tanks, top armor attacks, bogging and getting tracked.
     New terrain, weather and environment rules including Desert, Jungle, Alpine and Urban.
     Additional mission and campaign rules.

Name: Gift game: Nic nie ukryjesz
Description:
Pointing fingers is usually considered rude, but it's downright obligatory in this game!

One player reads the question, everyone counts down to three, and selects the person they think best fits the description. All players who fall into the majority group win a card. The first player to accumulate 5 cards wins the entire game.


Wskazywanie palcami jest zwykle uwaÅ¼ane za niegrzeczne, ale w tej grze jest wrÄ™cz obowiÄ…zkowe!Jeden z graczy odczytuje pytanie, wszyscy odliczajÄ… do trzech i wskazujÄ… osobÄ™, która wedÅ‚ug nich najlepiej pasuje do opisu. Wszyscy gracze, którzy znajdÄ… siÄ™ w grupie wiÄ™kszoÅ›ciowej, wygrywajÄ… kartÄ™. Pierwszy zawodnik, który zgromadzi 5 kart, wygrywa caÅ‚Ä… rozgrywkÄ™.

Name: Zabójczo wciągające: Śledztwo
Description:
Zabójczo wciÄ…gajÄ…ce: Åšledztwo is a party card game in which you can witness, compose a crime story or solve puzzles as part of the investigative team! Each role is equally important and each role is guaranteed to be fun! Feel the atmosphere and emotions of criminal puzzles while playing with your friends. Who will find the right track first, solve the mystery and be the winner?

The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

The game ends when one of the players correctly guesses the story made up by the one who draw the card.


Åšledztwo to towarzyska gra karciana, w której moÅ¼esz byÄ‡ Å›wiadkiem, ukÅ‚adaÄ‡ historiÄ™ zbrodni lub rozwiÄ…zywaÄ‡ zagadki jako czÅ‚onek zespoÅ‚u Å›ledczych! KaÅ¼da rola jest równie waÅ¼na i kaÅ¼da gwarantuje Å›wietnÄ… zabawÄ™! Poczuj klimat i emocje kryminalnych zagadek podczas rozgrywek ze znajomymi. Kto pierwszy wpadnie na prawidÅ‚owy trop, rozwiÄ…Å¼e zagadkÄ™ i okaÅ¼e siÄ™ zwyciÄ™zcÄ…?Gracze muszÄ… odgadnÄ…Ä‡ zbrodniÄ™, pytajÄ…c, zgadujÄ…c i bawiÄ…c siÄ™.

Gra koÅ„czy siÄ™, gdy jeden z graczy poprawnie odgadnie historiÄ™ wymyÅ›lonÄ… przez tego, który dobraÅ‚ kartÄ™.

Name: KILLWAGER
Description:
Killwager is an extremely tactical, small-unit based, realism focused Ultramodern and Near future tabletop game. Minimal tokens, full on narrative. It takes you from the modern day to a newly colonized planet 80 years into the future. The only consistencies? Cash and Violence..

Lead a hard team of near future mercenaries as they do the bidding of several powers in the area. Blazing a corpse soaked trail of glory, cash, and spent casings across intense "End of the movie" style direct action engagements.

During their turn, a player has one model perform (or two if they are within 4"), which consists of moving, shooting, taking cover, interacting with terrain, and many other measures. Any model performing can be targeted by a reactive measure. Moving across the battlefield can give your opponent an opportunity to stun, or eliminate outright, your moving asset. It's very simple and breaks down into individual actions with no math. Only increasing difficulty in performing your actions. No more adding 2 or three different modifiers together. Just one flat target number to roll a D10 and add your single stat to. That's right. One stat for the entire game

A game of Killwager can end in multiple ways. Typically, you want to get the most objective points, and exfiltrate off the battlefield, while trying to deny your opponent the same outcome. However, one player can be forced to end their play time prematurely if they hit pullout conditions specific during a scenario. Often times this is having too many assets killed. Once pullout conditions are met, a player must move all of their forces off the board edge or face capture by their opponent or death at the hands of 3rd party AI.

A player wins when points are counted up after a scenario or a chain of scenarios. Capturing objectives matter on the battlefield, and count towards your overall score. However, losing assets, including very important ones, or accidentally eliminating non-hostiles, will give you negative points. So even if you have the most people alive at the end of a match, you might not be the winner.

Name: Beano The Board Game
Description:
It is an average day in the school yard when you decide that it is time to play some pranks.

Players take turns to journey around Beano town and try to prank the different locations whilst avoiding the teacher. Perhaps you will drop a whoopee cushion at Mount Beano or splat custard pie at Bunkerton Castle. Will you be the first player to prank six different locations and win the game?

—description from the designer

Players each hold a hand of Prank cards, and take turns to roll dice to move their chosen character across the map, landing on spaces on which the they must perform the associated action.  Idea cards detailing a location and prank are collected along the way, and when a player has a matching combination of Idea and Prank, they can head to the specified location to perform the prank, banking the Idea card.

The Teacher piece is moved throughout the game and acts to bar your way across the board.

The winner is the first player to bank 6 idea cards.

Name: Paupers' Ladder: Bon-bons
Description:
First off, happy Christmas to you all!

This little print and play expansion adds the following to a game of Paupers' Ladder or The Moon Towers:

CRACKERS
Your Pauper will start the game with 3 Crackers. Some contain gifts, others tricks. Invite other players to pull a cracker with you when you occupy the same Region.

SPECIAL QUESTS
Each Pauper now comes with a Special Quest only they can complete. This contains updated versions of the Special Quests from the Christmas In Brighton expansion, plus Special Quests for all the Paupers from The Moon Towers and the Bodachs from The Brighthelm Bodachs.

Name: Dragonbond: Lords of Vaala – Scourge of Valerna
Description:
Bring in 4 new FACTIONS along with their characters and unique Vaala decks; 2 generals and 2 dragons. 
- Nahuac realm (Eirándi)
- Ysval realm (Oryan)
- Coatl dragon brood (Tetzcoatl)
- Exxor dragon brood (Rakzor)

This expansion can also increase player count up to 6 players (or replace other factions in games with 1-4 players to allow different combinations, maybe 4 dragons or 4 generals).

Name: Lotniczy Biznes
Description:
In the Lotniczy Biznes game, we become the president of a new airline, it is an extremely hermetic market and it is difficult for us to "enter the showrooms", especially since other airlines are opening with us, and our friends become their CEOs!

For our lines, every round opens the possibility of making one flight, on which you can either earn or lose, in case few passengers use your line! To make such a flight you have to negotiate the price with other CEOs, whoever gives the most rolls the dice.

Before game starts players draw a card with their main airport, a  'special ability' card and get one aircraft. Players can upgrade their aircraft, take a loan, and bids on flying to a destination. The player who wins the auction rolls the dice to see if they've made a profit. The first player to collect a billion Euro wins the game.

How much and whether you earn on the connection made depends on several factors, such as the economy of your plane, what airport is your home base, random events such as damaged landing gear and especially on how many passengers will use your line! By managing risk well, wisely investing in modernizing your machines or rejecting unprofitable connections, you will develop your airline and achieve success in this hellishly difficult aviation business!

The expanded edition contains : +10 random event cards  +2 starting airports cards (this means 7 players can play the game), +2 special ability cards (as above), +20 destination airports (60 vs 40, longer game), aircraft service fee (which you have to pay every round, depends on aircraft type), loans


W grze Lotniczy Biznes, stajemy siÄ™ prezesem nowej linii lotniczej, jest to niezwykle hermetyczny rynek i ciÄ™Å¼ko Nam "wejÅ›Ä‡ na salony", zwÅ‚aszcza, Å¼e razem z nami otwierajÄ… siÄ™ inne linie lotnicze, a ich prezesami zostajÄ… Nasi znajomi!Åšwiatowe lotniska sÄ… coraz bardziej zatÅ‚oczone i coraz popularniejszy jest handel slotami na lotniskach, im popularniejsze lotnisko, tym wiÄ™cej trzeba za taki slot zapÅ‚aciÄ‡, jednak jest to okazja dla linii, poniewaÅ¼ mogÄ… oni podnieÅ›Ä‡ cenÄ™ biletu oraz liczyÄ‡ na wiÄ™kszy zarobek! NajdroÅ¼szÄ… takÄ… transakcjÄ… w historii, byÅ‚ zakup poÅ‚Ä…czenia na Heathrow, American Airlines zapÅ‚aciÅ‚o aÅ¼ 60 milionów dolarów linii SAS, za ich miejsce!

Dla naszych linii co rundÄ™ otwiera siÄ™ moÅ¼liwoÅ›Ä‡ wykonania jednego poÅ‚Ä…czenia, na którym moÅ¼ecie albo zarobiÄ‡ albo straciÄ‡, w przypadku gdy maÅ‚o pasaÅ¼erów skorzysta z Waszej linii! Aby wykonaÄ‡ taki lot musicie negocjowaÄ‡ z innymi prezesami cenÄ™, kto da najwiÄ™cej, rzuca kostkÄ….

To ile i czy zarobicie na wykonanym poÅ‚Ä…czeniu zaleÅ¼y od kilku czynników, takich jak ekonomicznoÅ›Ä‡ Waszego samolotu, to jakie lotnisko jest Waszym portem macierzystym, zdarzeÅ„ losowych takich jak uszkodzone podwozie! A zwÅ‚aszcza od tego, ilu pasaÅ¼erów skorzysta z Waszej linii!

Dobrze zarzÄ…dzajÄ…c ryzykiem, mÄ…drze inwestujÄ…c w modernizacje swojej maszyny czy odrzucajÄ…c nierentowne poÅ‚Ä…czenia rozwiniecie swojÄ… linie i osiÄ…gniecie sukces na tym piekielnie trudnym lotniczym biznesie!

GrÄ™ wygrywa gracz, który jako pierwszy zgromadzi miliard Euro.

Name: Пираты Голицына
Description:
This game was invented and drawn back in 1934! Its author is Vladimir Mikhailovich Golitsyn from the famous Golitsyn family. In his youth, he was a sailor and sailed in the northern seas. Later, the sea became the main theme of his work. This version of the game has been significantly improved and made in a new graphic design (by KoTdeSigN).

The game uses both currents and wind force and shallows with rocks. From 2 to 9 people can play at the same time.

The players are divided into 2 teams: the Spaniards, whose task is to transport gold from South America to their homeland. And the pirates, whose task is gold, respectively, to take away.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kapteeni Koukun Aarre
Description:
The goal of this Disney licensed game is the same as in basic memory that you have to find matching pairs around the board and who finds the most wins the game. Moving happens by rolling the dice and you can move any of the three characters on the board. You get to see the tile that you land on and one any other tile to see if they match. If they do you get to roll again. The game lasts until all pairs have been found. The player with the most pairs wins the game.

—user summary

Hälytys, hälytys! Kapteeni Koukku ei löydä aarrettaan. Liity kapteenin joukkoihin ja auta häntä löytämään kadonnut aarre. Merirosvojenkin muisti reistailee joskus, mutta ehkä sinä voit auttaa heitä. Kyllä he jonnekin tänne piilottivat sen, mutta minne? Pärjätäksesi tarvitset hieman onnea, hyvän muistin ja merirosvon oveluutta. Kaikki mukaan jännittävälle aarrejahdille!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Bloody Harry
Description:
In this game inspired by the Harry Potter parody comic book, Your objective will be to win your house by earning as many victory points as possible. Collecting the lessons will be profitable for you but do not hesitate to use magic cards, because all the blows are allowed to grab the victory !!

You start the game with 5 magic cards in hand, the card of your house and its associated power and a number of school cards placed on the timetable, variable according to the number of players. On your turn, you perform 2 actions : Draw magic cards or collect a school card (at a variable cost depending on the number already in your possession). You can perform the same action twice. Do not hesitate to activate the effects of the school cards and play your magic cards in order to perfect your strategy, increase your score or, better yet, decrease that of other players by giving them bad points!
The game ends when a player has 10 school cards in front of him at the end of a turn. The winner is the one with the most victory points.

Name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 22
Description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 22 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:


     Battle Cobra T/F/G/I/J/X
     Doom Courser Prime/A/B/C/D
     Night Gyr T/F/G/X
     Goliath GOL-3M/3M2/7C/7K/7R
     Jade Phoenix Prime/A/B/C/D/E

Name: Betrayal: Santa & Minsc Promo
Description: This promotion is a reversible character card for Betrayal at House on the Hill and/or Betrayal at Baldur's Gate and adds Santa (Betrayal at House on the Hill) or Minsc, Beloved Ranger (Betrayal at Baldur's Gate) to the game.

Name: Sicher ist Sicher
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at "Start". The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

Name: Wine Rating Pocket
Description:
Wine Rating Pocket is a re-working of Wine RATING as a one or two player game. It is not possible to use two copies of Wine Rating Pocket to play Wine Rating. Whilst the gameplay is the same, the cards are changed in the Pocket game.

User summary
In the game of Wine Rating, you are a wine critic. You give a rating to wines from various countries, while investing in wineries to monopolize the market.

This game uses 4 investment tokens per player and 16 cards. On the table, there is a space to hold 16 cards in 4 x 4 square grid, and each row and column represents reputation of a winery in which players may invest. Each turn, you have two options: you may place a rating card, which ranges from -3 to +5, in the square grid, affecting two wineries; or you may place two investment tokens on any wineries.

At the end of the round, the investor on each winery takes the reputation score on that winery. After the third round, the investor calculates their total score.

Although the cards have Japanese text, you can play Wine Rating ignoring the text. There are two types of cards: winery cards and rating cards. Winery cards are written in English and Japanese, and all Japanese text on the Rating cards are just flavor. They gorgeously describes a wine in wine critics' comments. Japanese players can enjoy the text, but it is not necessary for gameplay.

Name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Tink Camp
Description:
This add-on includes:


     9 Miniatures: 1x Loot Tink, 4x Psycho Tinks, 4x Shotgun Tinks
     All game cards needed to play
     Bounty scenarios 


-description from the publisher

Name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Steve the Psycho
Description:
Contains:

     Steve the Psycho miniature
     boss, announcement, and other game cards
     Battle for the Spotlight digital scenario

Name: Wir wandern nach Halle
Description:
A number of dominoes are dealt to the players, who take turns adding dominoes to the display after the starting player has placed a domino on the table. If a player hasn't a matching domino to add, he has to take a domino from the stock. The first player who adds his last domino to the display has reached Halle and wins the game.

The dominoes show buildings, landscapes and hiking symbols.

—user summary

Name: ΛICE
Description:
ΛICE, a combination of the greek "Lamda" and "dice", is a trick-taking game for 3 to 4 players. The cards show the traditional suit and rank, but the illustration in the middle shows the card's rank made out of the sum of 1 or 2 die faces.  In addition to playing a card to a trick, a player may also play a die. If they do, after everyone has played a card, the players who also chose to play dice roll them and choose one of the eligible places on their card to place the die; it could change the value of the card up or down.  The card also becomes the color of the die.

Players earns points for hitting their bid of how many tricks they expected to win as well as tricks won and dice collected.  The player with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

Name: Old World: Roll and Write
Description:
Old World - Role and Write is a tabletop roll and write game set in the fictional world of "old world".

The aim of the game is to get the most points by placing races from the old world into the most optimal parts of the land. Some races love the mountains, other dwell in the forest. Some need to live close by to each other to survive, others like to live in solitude.

The game was created as a free print and play to be downloaded over the holidays of 2021, with the aim of bringing people together.

Name: 絑々 (syusyu)
Description:
çµ‘ã€… (syusyu) is a 2-player abstract strategy game from Japan (the theme is lipstick pieces).

At the start of the game, each player selects their six player pieces one by one. They have already received a card which restricts the placement of pieces, and so must select pieces from the pool to help their intended strategy. All pieces are visible to each player.

Then players take turns to place a piece on the grid board, such that the piece cannot be the same colour just payed, and they cannot break their own restriction card.

The player who cannot place a piece loses the game.

The game was launched at the Autumn 2021 Tokyo Game Market, with early reservations getting a special edition of pieces with little bows on them.
user summary

Name: Hush
Description:
On the other side of Earthshine, the evil spirits come out at night. They'll ravage anything in sight, as they feed on chaos and destruction. But you thrive for survival. Survival of yourself, your people, and your property, and ultimately, protecting the sacred creatures that you share the land with. You work hard to survive and you will not let the undead get in the way.

In Hush, 1+ players will work together to manage a group of commoners that are trying to survive the dangers of each passing night, and ultimately, protect the nocturnal creatures that live on the land. By day they will build resources, shelter, and develop techniques, and by night they will protect each other from the evil spirits that pass through. The goal is survival. How many nights can you make it before the spirits bring you down?

—description from the publisher


Starter Kit released for Board Game of the Month Club in March 2022.

6 monthly episodes released from March to August 2022 packages, that includes:

     Map postcard
     Character card
     Nocturnal Creature card
     Spirit card
     Structure card (every other month)

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Woodland
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Rolling Hills 2
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: AdvanceQuest: Chaos in the Chasm
Description:
A missing ambassador. A lost treaty. A strange asteroid. A deadly monster. You'll lead a team of gryphon raiders to investigate all of this (and more) in Chaos in the Chasm.

AdvanceQuest is a compact adventure system. Generate a character with any traits you want, and advance your way through the story, rolling dice against challenges and trying to reach the end.

A new chapter in the AdvanceQuest story is coming.

Using a clever new exploration mechanic, each foray into the story will offer different challenges using a simple combination of two elements. Select two of your own traits and roll off against the two story elements, and see if you can beat the dangerous situation. If you roll well, you survive to continue on. If you fail, you will take damage. But don't despair – you can spend Stamina to re-roll dice before you apply their effects! If you can make it through the story, you win! Your score is how many treasures you manage to collect along the way – see if you can beat your high score by playing again!

—description from the publisher


A solo micro-game designed by C.C. Chamberlin, based on Dungeon Hero. Create a hero using eight defining characteristics, like Archer of the Realm or Chainmail or Stealthy.  Assign them dice ranging from d12 to d6. Note your Health and Stamina levels, and then start the adventure.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Rolling Hills 1
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Box Canyon
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: Battleforce – MapPack
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Scattered Woods
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Citytech Map
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – City Ruins
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Desert Hills
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Open Terrain 2
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Open Terrain 1
Description: BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Name: 桜儷 (Sana)
Description:
æ¡œå„· (ã•ãª) (Sana) is a 2-player co-operative game from Japan. Players are apprentice Spring fairies, tasked with bringing the cherry blossom (Sakura) to flower. Both fairies don't want to let on that they are apprentice, and so do not talk as they work. The more flowers they can make bloom, they better they succeed.

The game title Sana is a contraction Sakura Narabu, meaning Line Up Blossoms. The kanji å„· (Narabu) is remarkably obscure. Hence the publisher has added the more simple hiragana ã•ãª to help readers as a furigana (pronunciation indicator).

The board shows ten open spaces for Sakura, each space being for five petals. Players will build up complete flowers on the spaces to win.

Each player has a number of petal pieces, showing 1 to 4 petals. They secretly take a petal in hand and show them together, without discussing what they are choosing.

If they have chosen different pieces, then they each place their chosen petals on the board. But an existing piece must be taken off the board to a storage area.

If they have chosen the same pieces to play (butting), again they place their pieces, but may now bring a piece from the storage area onto the board.

When places their pieces, the players can talk so to get optimal placement. But they cannot discuss what pieces they have left, not what to choose next turn.

There are also some placement conditions depending upon the number of petals. For example, a 3 petal piece can only go to an empty space.

Once a flower is complete, it cannot be changed. Pieces that cannot be placed are returned to hand.

The game ends in certain ways:
When a player runs out of pieces.
When all ten flowers are complete.
When the storage area has five pieces.

Then the players see how many flowers they have completed and praise or chastise themselves accordingly.
user summary

Name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Phantoms
Description: Experimental Tech Readout: Phantoms samples a number of high-technology designs developed for use by elite covert operatives and special military forces found throughout the Inner Sphere in the late-Jihad period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the advanced and experimental technologies found in Tactical Operations. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battlesuits presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

Name: The Family Dinner
Description:
It's dinner time and you're spending it with family! Some of which you haven't seen in a long time. As we all know, big family dinners always bring chaos. Even the happiest of families get wacky during big gatherings.

In The Family Dinner you’ll be playing as a dysfunctional family, having dinner together for the first time in a while. Each player acts as a member of the family. Play takes place over a number of courses with Ingredient Cards being used to drive the conversation and to shape what food is served. As you play you will be drawing a family tree that includes all players and extended family. The family is all here, let's start eating!

—description from the publisher

Name: BattleTech: The Wars of Reaving – Supplemental
Description: The Wars of Reaving Supplemental also includes Random Assignment Tables for the Reaving era and beyond, a short Strana Mechty mini-campaign, and fifty-one record sheets of units used throughout the conflict, including new OmniMechs and ProtoMechs introduced in The Wars of Reaving sourcebook.

Name: Panama Canal Trivia Game
Description:
This unique trivia challenge with a Panama Canal theme is designed to be enjoyed by up to four players.

Contestants roll a die to move around a pathway with spaces named for locations on or near the canal: Gatun Locks, Balboa, Gaillard Cut, etc. Question cards are color coded like playing cards: Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and Ten. The first player to obtain a "Royal Flush" is declared the winner.

Includes board, rules, question cards, tokens, a die, and information about the Panama Canal Museum.

Name: Safari-spel
Description:
Safari-spel is a roll and move game with a safari theme. Each round, roll a dice and move the number of squares it shows. If you end up in a square with an animal, read the instructions and follow it. First to the village in the middle of the game board wins.

Safari-spel was in the comic book "Musse Pigg & C: o" No. 2, February 1983. Musse Pigg is the swedish name for Mickey Mouse.

Name: BattleTech: Bruderkampf
Description:
Bruderkampf was designed to teach new BattleTech players. It contains a mini-campaign (a series of six connected scenarios) of increasing complexity that do not require the players to possess any additional products beyond a single boxed BattleTech starter set.

The scenarios are designed to be played using only the maps and BattleMechs from the Introductory box.

Name: Time Travel Entertainment, Inc.
Description:
The year is 2754. The multimedia conglomerate Time Travel Entertainment Inc. uses propietary technology to deploy its patented actor-bots anywhere in time and space.

With a complex goal and minimal programming, the hapless bots are turned loose for the audience's delight.

Each installment of their unscripted adventures is broadcast to trillions of eager viewers hungry for scenes of heoric triumph and hilarious failure.

In Time Travel Entertainment, Inc. players take on the roles of actor-bots. Choose the action from one of your CPUs for your next devious plan and share it with your fellow actors. If they do not approve you will need to rethink and try again, but once you have impressed them, use the die to find out if you plan succeeded. Beware - failing may damage your CPUs, removing them from the game. Achieve your goals or outlast the other actor-bots to win the game.

—description from the publisher


Before play begins, all players must agree together on what the premise of their robots' adventure in this game will be. To do this they must answer three simple questions:

     Where did they travel to?
     What year did they travel to?
     What are they trying to do?


Each player will select a robot type and take all three CPU cards. Select a player to set the scene with a short narration and then play begins with the player to their left.

On your turn, you will take exactly one action from your available CPU cards actions. Once you've chosen your action, explain to the group how you are going to use that action and the outcome you hope it will achieve. The player to your right will then decide if your proposed action is reasonable.

If your action is denied, you must choose a different action or a different resolution. If your action is approved, rotate the card so that a new action is available and roll the die to see if it succeeds. Your odds of success are based upon which CPU your action is coming from.

If your die roll was successful, you plan works. The player to your right narrates your success. If your action fails, they narrate exactly how you ended up failing. Then they narrate some consequences.

If you fail, roll a six-sided die to see if your failure results in any damage, by losing a CPU of your choice.

If a player loses their last CPU, they are dead and out of the game. Play continues until either you all accomplish your goal or everyone dies by losing all their CPUs.

Name: Shades of Ink
Description:
You weren't supposed to see them, the weathered cards with starnge inkblots. You didn't know the ink would curl and writhe as you looked at them. You tell yourself it's a nightmare, but the Shades you see are real... and they can see you too.

An interesting premise as a solo RPG told with only a few cards. When playing, you’ll get the chance to define the particular Shade you are encountering. This happens by a unique pair of prompts as well as an image, and it is up to you how to interpret these, as well as how to play out the encounter. Let your imagination run wild, telling of adventures that bring the storylines to life. Or just think of things in a practical way, coming up with a solution that is grounded in sensibility. The choice is yours, and only you can determine the right or wrong way to go about this unique encounter.

Shades of Ink is a solo role playing game where you will look at inkblots, note what you see, and then fight to destroy the shades that manifest from your visions. As you accumulate knowledge, the spirits' power also accumulates until it coalesces to form one final encounter.

Will you be able to overcome the Shades to escape the nightmare?

—description from the publisher

Name: Disney's-Jubileumsspel
Description:
Place "Kalles Kalas"-cards in a pile with the collector image side up. Roll the dice and move. If you end up on a question symbol, the player on the left must pick up a card and read the question with the same symbol in front. If you answer correctly, you have to roll the die again and move. If you answer incorrectly, you must remain in that circle and the next player in turn must roll the die. When a card has been used, it is placed back at the bottom of the pile. If you end up in a red circle, the next player will have to choose which category you must answer. Nothing happens on yellow circles. First in goal wins.

The game was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", No. 16, April 18, 1994. Kalle Anka is the swedish name for Donald Duck.

Name: BattleTech: Interstellar Expeditions – Interstellar Players 3
Description:
Nearly fifteen years have passed since the end of the Word of Blake Jihad and the rise of the Republic of the Sphere. Yet even as the Inner Sphere adjusts to a new sense of normalcy, questions remain about whether the Blakist threat is gone for good or merely hibernating.

Once a disorganized collective of hobbyists and academics backed by the idle wealthy, Interstellar Expeditions has emerged from the fires of war to take up the mission once claimed by ComStar's Explorer Corps: to search for the elusive hiding places where humanity's enemies might have gone. From the dead worlds within the borders of the Inner Sphere itself, to the distant, uncharted reaches of the Deep Periphery, IE relentlessly searches for the answers to mysteries dating back to mankind's first ventures into deep space, while simultaneously watching for any sign of the zealots who so recently waged the most horrendous interstellar war in modern history.

Interstellar Expeditions: Interstellar Players 3 describes the organization and efforts of Interstellar Expeditions as it continues to search within (and beyond) human-occupied space in the BattleTech universe. First introduced in Interstellar Players, IE's operations have now gone truly universal, seeking answers and treasures not only from the lost and forgotten worlds of humanity's distant past, but also the distant colonies and civilizations that have risen--and even fallen--beyond the boundaries of the Inner Sphere. Gamemasters and players can decide which of these groups and discoveries may actually bear fruit, and which are the misdirections left behind by the surviving leaders of the Blakist war machine. Whether from this sourcebook or the gamemaster's own imagination, these discoveries can become the ultimate villain, ally, or unique new setting for any type of BattleTech campaign!

Name: King of 12: die Arbeiterin, die Druidin & der Geduldige promo cards
Description:
Promo cards that make the three new characters from Council of 12 available for King of 12.

Die Arbeiterin (the worker):  
-1 or +1 to the cube value. Not above 12, or below 1

Die Druidin (the druidess): 
Tilt the cube 2x to one of the 5 adjacent sides. You cannot tilt it back.

Der Geduldige (the patient): 
Take 1 card from your discard pile into your hand

Name: BattleTech: HexPack – Promotion 1
Description:
The HexPacks are a flexible map system aid from the BattleTech game system. Designed for use in conjunction with other pre-printed mapsheets (such as those for the 25th Anniversary Introductory Box Set), the systems flexibility allows for easy modifications to existing mapsheets, increasing the enjoyment of a given scenario as players quickly change the terrain to bring new excitement to each game they play!

HexPack Promotion 1 is an expanded PDF of additional pre-constructed buildings, and DropShip record sheets, based upon the rules sheet found in the DropShip Promotional HexTile connected to HexPack: Cities and Roads.

Name: CARDtographer: Cooperative Storytelling Adventure
Description:
Tired of game nights that end with frustration, or staring at boring screens? Introducing CARDtographer, the collaborative storytelling card game for legendary heroes!

Enter a new world of adventure where you and your friends join forces with mighty heroes to create a map exploring the vibrant fantasy world of Terrath! Stand against dastardly villains, and cleanse your corruption, to stop the vile dragon Luxian from destroying the world! Trade cards and tell stories inspired by unique card prompts, but be ready for when Luxian swoops down to raid your lands! Play as 6 unique hero classes with world-saving abilities. Enjoy laughs, intrigue, infinite replay, and story variety! Easy to learn fun to play. Now is your time to fight the dragon, not each other!

Players work together to create a world map (3x3 card square) by telling exploration adventure stories before the evil dragon Luxian destroys the world!

On your turn, draw a card, and then you may choose to do one of the following:

1. Trade - Trade one Story card (Hero, Villain, or Location) for another player’s Story card.
2. Cleanse - Remove a Corruption card from your hand by discarding it and a matching “cleansing” Hero card.
3. Explore - Tell a solo story exploring a land by combining one of each Story card type (Hero, Villain, and Location).
4. Raid - Instantly join forces with all the other players to tell a combined story standing against a random raid attack by the evil dragon Luxian!

The game ends when every player has told at least one solo story, and all 9 “map” slots are filled with cards. Explored Locations, failed Raids, and Corruption cards form a 3x3 grid on the table, completing your map. The group scores (1) victory point for each successfully explored Location card. If the majority of the 9 cards are successfully explored Locations, the heroes are victorious! If all 9 are successfully explored Locations, celebrate a perfect victory as top tier “CARDtographers”!

Name: Tiger Stripes: The Card Game
Description:
Long ago a great mother tigress had four cubs. After many days she instructed her growing tigers, "Go out into the far reaches of the world and seek your fortunes. Hunt for prey to earn your stripes and become powerful. Have many wonderful adventures.

Players are tiger cubs trying to earn their stripes by capturing matching sets of Prey Cards.  This is done by drawing cards from the deck and trading cards from their hand to match gems on the cards. The first player to place seven stripes on their player card is the winner

Name: BattleTech: Historical – Reunification War
Description:
In 2570, the six Great Houses of the Inner Sphere united to create the Star League, promising to bring an end to the generations of warfare that engulfed the worlds mankind now called home. Shortly thereafter, to seal their alliance, they turned against the various independent realms of the Periphery. Over the next twenty years, the so-called Reunification War would rage, claiming more lives than the savagery of the Age of War before it, all to realize House Cameron's dream of a united humanity--at any cost.

Historical: Reunification War describes the first grand military campaign of the newborn Star League against the collected realms of the Periphery. Covering each of the four major campaign theaters in detail, this book provides a hard look at the formative years of the first Star League, and the fateful decisions that led them to usher in a new Golden Age for mankind by unleashing their armies against its most far-flung worlds.

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Merciless Minions Pack #1
Description:
You can't conquer a planet without an army! The forces of the Machine Empire and Ransik's mutants are here and hellbent on attacking humanity. These foot soldiers might not be so tough individually, but a swarm of them will prove a handful for any Ranger. Enemy bosses rely on their merciless minions to batter the Power Rangers’ defenses and soften them up for the monstrous heavy hitters.

The Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Merciless Minions Pack #1 expansion pack includes the Machine Empire's Cogs and Ransik's Cyclobots, as well as an alternate Putty Patroller enemy deck representing Lord Zedd's terrifying Chaos Putties!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Time Force Ranger Pack
Description:
"Time for Time Force!" —Time Force Morphing Call

In the year 3000, global peace is maintained by an elite organization of Power Rangers who protect the past, present, and future. Time Force travels through time to stop the mutant criminal Ransik, the dark machinations of Lord Drakkon, and all manner of evil threats.

Thanks to Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Time Force Ranger Pack, Wes Collins, Lucas Kendall, Trip, Katie Walker, and Eric Myers are here to save the day. With their unique array of skills and weaponry, time is on their side!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

Name: When Gods Collide
Description:
This is a fantasy themed 4-player version of MetaCheckers: Battlefield with all-wood, laser cut pieces. Play as one of four ancient gods:
• Zeus / Greek temples
• Odin / viking ships
• Amun-Ra / sphinxes
• Marduk / Babylonian ziggurats

Each player gets 6 board tiles - four squares each - which they take turns placing on the field of play, connecting the tiles to form a unique battlefield.  Players place their 12 checkers strategically on the squares of their tiles, with the kings hidden, face down at the beginning of the game. Eliminate your opponents by capturing their god / king.

On their turn, players roll two dice to determine how to move a checker. One die has the symbols for chess pieces, the other is a standard d6 numbers die.  Whenever a 6 is rolled, the player may opt to reroll with the HERO Die and the numbers die for 6 additional useful moves.

Players eliminate their opponents by capturing the hidden god / king of the opposing army, which then leaves the board. Last player standing wins.

Name: BattleTech: Era Report – 3062
Description: Era Report: 3062 describes the state of the Inner Sphere and the Clans at a divisive period in BattleTech history: the latter years of the Clan Invasion. Presented as a general overview of the period, rather than a focused report on a single conflict, this book includes descriptions of many major Inner Sphere, Periphery, and Clan factions. Notable personalities, military forces, and an overview of the technological capabilities of the Inner Sphere and Clan powers of this critical period in history are also provided, along with special advanced-level rules for campaigns set in this era, whether played using the Total Warfare core rules or those found in A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG.

Name: BattleTech: Handbook – Major Periphery States
Description: Handbook: Major Periphery States collates the essential history, politics and culture of the Major Periphery States into a single volume. More than a mere sourcebook, Handbook: Major Periphery States provides rules for both BattleTech and A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG game play, including new support vehicles, creatures and more!

Name: BattleTech: Handbook – House Kurita
Description: Handbook: House Kurita cover the pivotal history, politics and cultures of the Inner Sphere's most feared Great Houses. Not just a sourcebook, Handbook: House Kurita covers rules for both BattleTech and A Time of War game play, including such areas as personal equipment, support vehicles, creatures and more.

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Foot Soldier Promo Pack #1
Description:
Lord Drakkon conquered his alternate world with an army of Rangers under his control.  Use this alternate combat deck for the Mastodon Troopers to give the Rangers a greater challenge.

Includes a 10 card combat deck for Ranger Sentries, intended for use with the Mastodon Trooper miniatures from the Shattered Grid expansion.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Zord Pack #2
Description:
Reclaim the legendary Shogunzords from Lord Zedd and his minions, in order to field their ancient might against your adversaries.

Includes:
Black Shogunzord card
White Shogunzord card
Blue Shogunzord card
Yellow Shogunzord card
Red Shogunzord card
Shogun Megazord card
Shogun Ultrazord card

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid

Name: Stick 'Em Up
Description:
A western outlaw game where you draw from two decks, racing to accumulate 50 total gold.

Players take turns drawing cards, laying gold bag cards face up and leaving any others in their hands. This is where the element of cheating comes in, you only have to reveal your hand if someone draws The Jig is Up card, then all players reveal the hands and pay their debts/loss of turns.

This is the second edition of the game. I added what was to be the first expansion to just be part of the base game, adding an additional 54 cards that really brings the "bad guy" feel to the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Ringfrei
Description:
Each player starts with 5 colored rings on his game piece, which should move from there to the personal ring tray as quickly as possible. To do this, questions about the topics of body, mind and soul must be answered and tasks must be solved. Through wrong answers and events you have to put new rings on your figure. The first player to collect at least 8 rings on his ring tray and only carry a maximum of 2 rings on his game piece wins.

—user summary

Name: What's Next?: A Life-Size Game
Description:
What's Next? A Life-Size Game will hold the interest of your kids, and to give everyone the chance to share something truly valuable with them — laughter and family fun for all ages!

Fill your home with smiles, active entertainment, and endless joy.

It's the perfect addition to your family's game night. Bond with your kids and leave the screens behind.

Name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Robot Revolution
Description:
Expansion contains:

- 19 Miniatures: 1x Intergalactic Ninja Assassin Claptrap, 4x Kamikaze Claptraps, 6x Punk-Stabby Claptraps, 8x Partisan Claptraps
- 40 new double sided game hexes
- All game cards needed to play
- Bounty scenarios 
- Crush the Revolution campaign

–description from the publisher

Name: Cartoon Network Crossover Crisis: Professor Utonium Promo Card
Description:
Cartoon Network Crossover Crisis: Animation Annihilation Deck building game - Professor Utonium Promo Card.

At the start of each of your turns you may put a card with cost 4 or less from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck.

Name: Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion x Cat & Chocolate
Description:
Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion x Cat & Chocolate is a standalone game that uses the same gameplay as Cat & Chocolate with characters, items, and situations from the Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion anime.

Each turn, the active player must use 1-3 items in hand to avoid threats, creating a convincing story that incorporates these somewhat random objects. After you tell the story, everyone else votes on whether or not you succeeded. If a majority backs you, you keep the threat card; otherwise, you don't. Each player secretly belongs to either the CODE or the GEASS team, and you naturally want to vote for the players on your team, but no one knows who is on which team.

After a certain number of threats, the game ends, players reveal which team they belong to, and each team tallies the number of threats that their members escaped. Whichever side avoided more threats wins!

Name: Babar
Description:
A competitive memory game using a standard 52-card deck.

The goal is to be the player with the lowest score at the end of each round by exchanging cards face down with the other players. You can't look at a card and keep it at the same turn, so you better remember it!

The game ends as soons as one player reaches 77 points or more. The player with the lowest score wins!

Name: Rain-Bo
Description:
From the box:

Rain-Bo is the racing rainbow card where gray skies are going to clear up & you put on a happy face.

In Rain-Bo, players race to be the first to fill their hand with the seven colors of the rainbow.

To do this, they clear their clouds away & let the sun shine in by strategically swapping & saving cards!

There's no numbers, no complex rules, just fun for everyone!

___________________________________________

Play starters with a pile of cloud cards & each turn they select a sun card from the centre. The player then exchanges their cloud cards that match that sun cards color.

The first player to have a sun card of each color is the winner!

Name: Ridley's Games Room: The Name Game Quiz
Description:
A quick-fire guessing game suitable for all ages. Describe the famous person without using the words on the cards and see just how many your team mates can guess to win the game

Players take a card which lists a famous person and 5 words, titles, etc. which they are identified with. Players describe the famous person without using the words on the cards.  Whoever guesses the person wins the card.  The team with the most cards at the end of the game, wins.

Name: Star Fleet Battles Commander's Rulebook Update II
Description:
A 64-page rulebook expansion for Star Fleet Battles: Commander's Rulebook.

This product was designed to be taken apart and integrated into the previous volumes of the rulebook.

Update #2 includes a compilation of SFB material that had previously appeared in other sources, such as Nexus magazine.  Much of this material has been updated and revised for Update #2, and some entirely new material is also included.

Name: Escape from Earth
Description:
The Faction needs you! The End is near and you are there, looking at your cell phone, sweetie! They called them conspiranoids, they laughed at them, and the vast majority did not heed the signals, but NOW ITS HERE.

The famous Meteor that everyone has heard of is about to collide with our planet and the Government continues to deny it to avoid chaos. The time has come to decide: Do you accept your fatal destiny or do you rebel and fight to create a new one, safe from Final Destruction? Are you willing to face your friends and family to the last consequences? Steal their resources and boycott their advances? Will you leave them lying at the last minute in order to save your skin? Congratulations. You are the kind of person that Escape From Earth needs!

The player in his turn draws cards and performs actions on the cards in his hand. He can attack another player or draw resource cards from a market. The objective is to obtain cards that have the 5 types of resources.

Name: Age of Penda: Battle Games In Seventh Century Britain
Description:
In this gridded-layout miniature wargame, you take the role of a seventh-century warlord or king leading your army on the battlefield. You must choose where and how to focus your warriors' actions and control the battle’s impetus. The battle is partly fought on the tabletop like other miniature wargames but is also fought just as hard on the Tactics Chart, providing an additional mind-game against your opponent.

Command your units to move and fight in the areas of the battlefield you wish, but leave the actual process of fighting to your units' commanders. This is represented by the random factor of dice and each of your units’ abstract but often-decreasing Battle Rating. Because of this, your focus is kept where it should be – out-thinking your opponent by using superior tactics and exploiting their weaknesses on the battlefield.

Age of Penda is not intended as a heavy simulation of medieval warfare but as an enjoyable, simple, and fast-playing battle game themed around seventh-century warfare.

You’ll find that much of the action is stylized and streamlined. Don’t think of “turns” in the usual wargaming way – in each turn your units may fight or move several times, countered by your opponent after every action, creating a very fluid game but at the same time making cohesive planning difficult to achieve.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Lucky Dog
Description:
Lucky Dog is a dice game where the dog always wins. There are two ways to play: A free-for-all 2-4 player version, and a 2 player cooperative version.

In the free-for-all version players take turns revealing 5 cards with parameters (such as 3 of a kind, 3 in a row, two pair, etc.) The player rolls 5 six sided dice and then may discard and reveal one new card. The player then gets an opportunity to reroll any of the dice up to twice, trying to fulfill the parameters of as many of the cards as possible. When they are done re-rolling, they take and score any of the revealed cards that the dice fulfill the parameters for. Players take turns in this manner until a player reaches 20 points, then the player with the most points at the end of the round wins.

In the 2 player cooperative version, each player will have 2 hidden cards in their hand. The player who's turn it is rolls all five dice and choose to 'keep' any of the dice, but must choose at least one. The second player takes and rolls any of the un-kept dice, then they can keep any of the dice, but must keep at least one. Players roll dice back and forth like this until all dice are kept. As soon as that happens, both players can score any cards in their hand that the dice meet the parameters for. If the players collectively score at least one card, they may keep playing by drawing up to two cards and starting a new round. If they can't score a card, it's game over with a total score equal to all the cards scored.

Name: Godzilla Battle: Monster Card Showdown!
Description:
Godzilla Battle: Monster Card Showdown! is a two-player battle card game based on rock-paper-scissors. Choose one from each of the four popular monsters: "Godzilla," "Mothra," "King Ghidorah," and "Mechagodzilla," and aim to win the battle by utilizing skills and playing cards like a fighting card game.

Similar to the rules of rock-paper-scissors, the success or failure of a match is determined by the choosing of one of the three fighting styles "Goo, Par, Choki" (Rock, Paper, Scissors) written on the card. Keep in mind though that even if you lose the fighting style choice, you can still overcome your opponent and win by utilizing your monster's special abilities. There are a variety of effects monsters have using these special abilities. You'll have to play to find out and master them all!

Let's aim for victory by making full use of powerful techniques!

Name: Het ANWB vakantie spel
Description:
When going on vacation you do a lot of fun stuff like flying kites, swimming or building sandcastles. But be sure to pick up your beloved items at the ANWB-shop and be the first player to deliver all your items at your vacation home.

Throw the colored die to see how far you can drive your car and strategically place traffic lights to block your opponents roads.

—user summary

Name: Love Match
Description:
In Love Match it's all about love, friendship, romance, fun and surprises. Learn new things about love and be smarter than your opponents and be the first one to find your love match. 
But it's not only about knowing the most about love. Sometimes you have to complete challenges in order to win hearts.

When it's your turn, throw a dice. Where you land determines what you must do that turn. You can  either answer a trivia question about love or friendship. When it's good you stay on your spot, when you answer it wrong you go back to the place you came from. You can get questions about how well you know the other players.  Or you can lend on a duel. Where you must try to match the answer that the other player picks. Each time you succeed you will get a heart. If you are the first player to reach the end of the heart shaped track with three hearts you are the winner.

—user summary

Name: Noordhollands Dagblad spel
Description:
In this game you play a journalist who tries to collect news stories in different places. The more news you manage to gather, the more ads you will get. And you will need those ads in order to make a complete newspaper. 
But beware, not every lead will give you a story worth writing about, sometimes it's a dead end.

On the board you see a map of the province of North Holland. Across you will see roads with different color circles on it When it's your turn you throw a dice and move your pawn that many spaces. On the news article cards you will see the name of the place you have to go to in order to collect them. There are six different categories of news: Regional news, World news, Economics, background stories, Culture and Sports. Each one with their own color. You have to gather an article from every category and four ads in order to win.
The top card from the ad deck lies open for everyone. It shows the required colors of the news categories you need to have in order to get the ad.

—user summary

Name: Conflict of Heroes: Kursk '43 – Nordfront
Description:
A Missions Expansion for Conflict of Heroes: Storms of Steel – Kursk 1943 (Third Edition)

This expansion is centered on the battle near the towns of Ponyri and Olkhovatka, which both sides considered as vital positions.

Name: キャット＆チョコレート: Gachapin x Mukku (Cat & Chocolate: Gachapin Challenge Edition)
Description:
ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒƒãƒˆï¼†ãƒãƒ§ã‚³ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒˆ: Gachapin x Mukku (Cat & Chocolate: Gachapin Challenge Edition) is a standalone game that uses the same gameplay as Cat & Chocolate with characters, items, and situations from the children's television programs "Hirake! Ponkikki" and "Ponkickies".

Each turn, the active player must use 1-3 items in hand to avoid threats, creating a convincing story that incorporates these somewhat random objects. After you tell the story, everyone else votes on whether or not you succeeded. If a majority backs you, you keep the threat card; otherwise, you don't. Each player secretly belongs to either the Gachapin or the Mukku team, and you naturally want to vote for the players on your team, but no one knows who is on which team.

After a certain number of threats, the game ends, players reveal which team they belong to, and each team tallies the number of threats that their members escaped. Whichever side avoided more threats wins!

Name: Truth or Drink: Second Edition
Description:
The all-new Second Edition of Truth or Drink contains 410 intensely personal questions across 4 different levels of intimacy.

This updated edition contains over 80% new and revised questions from the original, but as before, they're grouped into:

Happy Hour: For when you need help being nice. Get to know your acquaintances better.
On the Rocks: Get more personal with these good-friends questions featuring just the right amount of bite.
Last Call: Probing questions for your deepest and darkest friendships.
Extra Dirty: Extremely NSFW questions will have you learning way more than you should.
Each box also contains our brand-new Buy a Round cards, to make more people answer any question, as well as a handful of blank cards, for brewing up your own spicy inquiries.

Add one of our expansion packs (available separately) for an even more probing experience. Will you tell the cold hard truth or have a nice stiff drink?

—description from the publisher

Name: The Big Shuffle: A Film Noir Card Game
Description:
The Big Shuffle is a film noir card game where you are trying to make your way in an uncaring city. You play a classic noir character who is trying to set up the perfect scene for their agenda. You have to play smart though, as it is easy for someone else to change the scene for their benefit also. Full of role playing opportunities, The Big Shuffle pairs well with a cigar, whiskey, and smooth jazz.

In essence it is a 2-4 player game where everyone gets a different set of win conditions and you are trying to stop the others from hitting theirs with the scene cards in the middle. You not only have to plan your turn to try and change it to your win condition, but also use your reaction cards to try and stop others from winning on their turn keeping gameplay interactive and interesting even when someone else is trying to swing things in their favor.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Game of Heroes and Events
Description: Players compete to be the first to complete a complete suit of cards. Each card recounts a Hero or Event from US history. Players travel around the game board, collecting and exchanging cards until they have complete the suit.

Name: Valdés
Description:
Valdés is an animal watching game, a card game for kids.

Each turn, a player will play 2 of their 3 cards on each animal postcard, and if there are 4 cards of the same animal, they earn a postcard of that animal. First player to get to 5 different animal postcards, wins.

Name: Inspector
Description:
The fabulous Purple Puma Diamond has been stolen, and there’s only one person who can catch the thief: THE INSPECTOR

In this game, each player takes a turn as The Inspector, while the other players play as the tricky thieves. The thieves switch and swap their cards around, each trying to get the diamond for themselves without revealing its location to the watchful Inspector.

Pit your wits against your friends and family in a game of bluffing and deduction!

—description from the publisher

Name: A Story of the Three Kingdoms
Description:
An issue game of Command Magazine Japan #162 in 2021.

Strategic level wargame for Chinese Three Kingdoms Era.
The game engine is the as same the Rivalry of Local Barons of the same game designer.

Each turn, players select one of six revealed warlord cards. The top order card can be taken free, but second or later card is require a "Heaven's will" chit. And these chits can be taken by the later chooser of the skipped cards.
Each warlord card has various strength and special ability for invasion and control many provinces. Combined support cards also offer a variety of bonuses.
The battle is resolved by a die with a very simple combat result table.

The winner is determined by victory points, earned from mostly control of provinces, and other bonuses.
Families: Theme: Romance of the Three Kingdoms

Name: Den vilda jakten på lejonkungen
Description:
When it´s your turn you roll the die and move the number of squares the die show. First in goal wins. This is a Disney´s the Lion king theme game.

The game was published in the comic book "Kalle Anka & C:o" no. 50, 12 December 1994. Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck.

Name: Den stora skattjakten
Description:
Each participant places their game figure on one of the four colored starting fields and the obstacles are placed on the red squares. The one who rolls the highest number on the die begins. The participants move their figures as many fields as the die show. You can choose which path you want, but it is not allowed to jump over obstacles. They can only be cleared out of the way if you end up directly on the square where the obstacle stands. Then you can put the obstacle where you want, preferably so that it stands in the way of the opponents. If you end up in the same field as an opponent, the opponent must start over. The one who first ends up directly on the square with the treasure chest has won.

The game was included in "Kalle Anka & C:o", no. 39, 20 September 1996.

Name: Fyll säcken med skatter!
Description:
The treasure marks are placed on the game board - anywhere except on the squares along the edges. The participants each take their game figure and a sack and put them in their respective corners on the game board. In the bag you collect the treasures.

Roll the dice and move as many squares as it shows. You can go in any direction you want, except diagonally. NOTE! If an opponent gets in the way and you end up in a square with an opponent - you have to start over! The goal is to end up in a square where the treasure marks are, collect the treasure and put the mark in the bag. The game is over when the last treasure mark is put in the bag. The one who has the most treasure marks has then won.

The game was included in the comic book "Kalle Anka & C:o", no. 39, 20 September 1996.

Name: Skurkregister
Description:
All but one of the villainous faces should be covered with the villainous images. The pictures are placed upside down and the cards are placed randomly.

It's about finding face pairs. In turn, you turn over the cards, compare with the image on the board that becomes visible and put the image back if it is not a pair.

If you get the right card, place it with the image facing up in the box with the same image. The box where the card was located will now be open and it is important to find that face. So you continue until all the face pairs are found. For each pair you get one point. If you find a pair, you have to try again. If you do not find the right face, the tour continues. The one with the best memory and the most points wins.

This game was included in the comic book "Kalle Anka & C:o", no. 39, 20 September 1996.

Name: Stockholm rundt på 140 minuter
Description:
The name of the game, Stockholm rundt på 140 minuter, is Swedish for "Around Stockholm in 140 minutes".

This is a game where you walk thru Stockholm in the year 1910. Each turn you roll the die and move that number of dots. If you end up on a red dot, then read the instructions and follow them. First to the center of Stockholm wins.

Name: Sloth in my Broth
Description:
Sloth in my Broth is a fast-paced, action packed skill game from Anker Play Products.

Objective: 
There is a Sloth sleeping in your noodles that you want to keep out of your bowl.

Set Up:
Lay the spaghetti noodle pieces across the top of the bowl in a criss-cross fashion.

Rules:
Players take turns carefully removing noodles without letting the Sloth fall into your broth!

     Spin the spinner and remove the number of noodles shown. Once you touch a noodle that is the noodle you must remove. 
     Players may only use one hand to remove the noodles from the bowl. 


To Win:
The player that drops the Sloth in the Broth get desqualified [sic]. Set up again and keep playing. Last player to stay in the game WINS!

—description from the publisher

Name: Cluedo Batman Edition
Description:
In this game we find ourselves playing the opponents of the superhero. The title includes up to a maximum of four players, who can however choose from the most iconic villains of Gotham City: Bane, Joker, Catwoman, Mr. Freeze, The Riddler and Harley Quinn.

Each villain will have a Criminal Plan to carry out, developed in different missions (such as taking control of specific territories or making certain results with the dice). Achieving a certain number of objectives will activate the character's special powers, giving the player various advantages during the rest of the game.

While the villains compete for the districts of Gotham City (following the traditional RisiKo dice-rolling mechanic!), our hero is not standing idle. When five 1's are rolled during a turn, Batman goes into action, clearing one or more territories on the board and wreaking havoc in the fight for control of the metropolis. Especially in the initial stages it will not be easy to watch, but it will always be a great emotion to swoop into our opponents. It will be less pleasant when it's our turn to face the Dark Knight, but that's part of the challenge too.

In addition to conquering all of Gotham, you can take home the game by completing one of three objectives, common to all participants. However, every time a criminal empire is definitively defeated, the player who accomplished the feat can choose to eliminate one of the conditions.
Families: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

Name: Connecting London
Description:
Connecting London is a strategy game, where 2-6 players build the iconic Zone 1 London Underground Map and work to be the first to complete their underground sign, all while dodging surprises along the way. While collecting map tiles, you will need to make connections between London mainline stations and famous landmarks. Can you stay on track to win, or will you be derailed by another passenger? Test your skills in this fast-paced board game as you make the most connections and become the King or Queen of the underground!
—description from the publisher

This is a tile-placement game.
Map tiles are drawn at random, with each player having a "hand" of 5 tiles.
During their turn, players add tiles to the board, aiming to connect stations with tourist attractions.
The game is won by the first player who successfully makes 5 connections to complete their underground sign.
Box contains: 53 map tiles, 6 sets of scoring tiles, 1 game board, 1 travel bag

Name: Invocación Fronteras: Campeadores
Description:
Summoners battles always had that gallantry of taking the summons with the greatest potential as a trophy by winning a demonstration, but they know that this summon has sworn loyalty to its summoner... but the supreme summoners learned to break those bonds, to bend the will of emperors and gods, marking who rules in this territory...

Advanced game mode expansion for InvocaciÃ³n Fronteras.

Includes 2 promo cards:

     Domador del Craken (12 - Water): Lower 3 Power to all Fire and Earth.
     Eva (36 - Fire): If this card is Invocation destroy 2 Mana from a players reserve.



High difficulty for Summoning Masters

In this game mode, summoners will be forced to prove their ability on the battlefield. The number of cards in play is limited but will have new tactical resources to use to your advantage. In this new game mode, trophies can be used so points are scored separately.

Name: Sucesos Argentinos: 3 Presidencias promo card
Description:
A promo card for Sucesos Argentinos about the 3 middle presidencies in Argentinian "5 presidents in a week" collapse, adding one more event for your timeline.


     Ramón Puerta
     Eduardo Camaño
     Adolfo Rodríguez Saá

Name: Asteroids Chasers
Description:
Will you be able to mine the most from asteroids without dying?

Be careful, 3 active mines and the asteroid field explodes, along with your profits!

Avoid pirate ships that paralyze your probes.

Objective:

Your goal is to play all the cards from your deck, and make the best score.

To do so, you play each card from your deck with the following rules:

     the card can never cover a previously played card
     the card must be placed adjacent (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) to the previously played card.


You lose the game if there are no legal moves and at least a card is not played, of if there are 3 active Mines at the same time in the playfield.

You win the game if you managed to put all cards from the deck in the play field.

Includes solo, 2 player competitive & 2 player cooperative modes.
